snippet: A report by a Russian cybersecurity firm says a global gang of thieves penetrated banking systems to steal millions of dollars.
abstract: Russian cybersecurity firm Kaspersky Lab prepares to release report uncovering vast malware infiltration through which cybercrimnals were able to penetrate more than 100 banks and other financial institutions in 30 nations; report finds evidence of some $300 million in thefts, though no bank has yet come forward to acknowledge loss; majority of targets were in Russia, though many others were in Japan, United States and Europe.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH

lead_paragraph: A report by a Russian cybersecurity firm says a global gang of thieves penetrated banking systems to steal millions of dollars.

headline.main: Bank Hackers Steal Millions via Malware
headline.print_headline: Bank Hackers Steal Millions via Malware
